00190    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00191    AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::AutoCorrArray()

00193       corr_(),
00194       nCorr_(),
00195       ensembleCapacity_(0),
00196       bufferCapacity_(0),

00208    /*
00209    * Read parameters from file.
00210    */
00211    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00212    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::readParam(std::istream& in)
00213    {
00214       readBegin(in, "AutoCorrArray");
00215 
00216       read<int>(in, "ensembleCapacity", ensembleCapacity_);
00217       read<int>(in, "bufferCapacity",   bufferCapacity_);
00218       nEnsemble_ = ensembleCapacity_;
00219       allocate();
00220 
00221       readEnd(in);
00222    }
00223    
00224    /*
00225    * Set parameters and initialize.
00226    */
00227    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00228    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::setParam(int ensembleCapacity, int bufferCapacity)
00229    {
00230       ensembleCapacity_ = ensembleCapacity;
00231       bufferCapacity_   = bufferCapacity;
00232       allocate();
00233       nEnsemble_        = ensembleCapacity;
00234    }
00235 
00236    /*
00237    * Set or reset nEnsemble.
00238    */
00239    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00240    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::setNEnsemble(int nEnsemble)
00241    {
00242       if (ensembleCapacity_ == 0) 
00243          UTIL_THROW("No memory has been allocated: ensembleCapacity_ == 0"); 
00244       if (nEnsemble > ensembleCapacity_) 
00245          UTIL_THROW("nEnsemble > ensembleCapacity_");      
00246       nEnsemble_ = nEnsemble;
00247    }
00248 
00249    /* 
00250    * Set previously allocated to initial empty state.
00251    */
00252    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00253    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::clear()
00254    {   
00255       setToZero(sum_);
00256       nSample_ = 0;
00257 
00258       if (bufferCapacity_ > 0) {
00259 
00260          int i;
00261          for (i = 0; i < bufferCapacity_; ++i) {
00262             setToZero(corr_[i]);
00263             nCorr_[i] = 0;
00264          }
00265    
00266          for (i = 0; i < ensembleCapacity_; ++i) {
00267             buffers_[i].clear();
00268          }
00269 
00270       }
00271 
00272    }
00273    
00274    /*
00275    * Allocate arrays and CyclicBuffer (private method).
00276    */
00277    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00278    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::allocate()
00279    { 
00280       if (bufferCapacity_ > 0) { 
00281  
00282          // Allocate autocorrelation accumulators
00283          corr_.allocate(bufferCapacity_);
00284          nCorr_.allocate(bufferCapacity_);
00285    
00286          // Allocate buffers
00287          buffers_.allocate(ensembleCapacity_);
00288          for (int i=0; i < ensembleCapacity_; ++i) {
00289             buffers_[i].allocate(bufferCapacity_);
00290          }
00291 
00292       }
00293       clear();
00294    }
00295    
00296    /*
00297    * Sample a single value from a time sequence.
00298    */
00299    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00300    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::sample(const Array<Data>& values)
00301    {
00302       int i, j;
00303 
00304       ++nSample_;
00305 
00306       for (i = 0; i < nEnsemble_; ++i) {
00307          sum_ += values[i];
00308          buffers_[i].append(values[i]);
00309       }
00310       
00311       int bufferSize = buffers_[0].size();
00312       for (j=0; j < bufferSize; ++j) {
00313          for (i = 0; i < nEnsemble_; ++i) {
00314             corr_[j] += product(buffers_[i][j], values[i]);
00315          }
00316          ++nCorr_[j];
00317       };
00318    }
00319    
00320    /*
00321    * Return capacity of history buffer for each sequence.
00322    */
00323    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00324    int AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::bufferCapacity() const
00325    {  return bufferCapacity_; }

00327    /*
00328    * Return number of independent sequences.
00329    */
00330    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00331    int AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::nEnsemble() const
00332    {  return nEnsemble_; }
00333 
00334    /*
00335    * Return number of sampled values.
00336    */
00337    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00338    int AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::nSample() const
00339    {  return nSample_; }
00340 
00341    /*
00342    * Return average of sampled values.
00343    */
00344    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00345    Data AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::average() const
00346    {
00347       Data ave = sum_;
00348       ave /= double(nSample_*nEnsemble_);
00349       return ave;
00350    }
00351 
00352    /*
00353    * Final output.
00354    */
00355    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00356    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::output(std::ostream& outFile) 
00357    {
00358       Data    ave = average();
00359       Product autocorr;
00360       Product aveSq;
00361    
00362       // Calculate and output autocorrelation
00363       aveSq = product(ave, ave);
00364       int bufferSize = buffers_[0].size();
00365       for (int i = 0; i < bufferSize; ++i) {
00366          autocorr = corr_[i]/double(nCorr_[i]*nEnsemble_);
00367          //autocorr = autocorr - aveSq;
00368          //outFile << Int(i) << Dbl(autocorr) << Int(nCorr_[i]) << std::endl;
00369          outFile << Int(i) << Dbl(autocorr) << std::endl;
00370       }
00371       
00372    }
00373    
00374    /*
00375    *  Return correlation time in unit of sampling interval  
00376    */
00377    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00378    double AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::corrTime() const
00379    {
00380       Data    ave;
00381       Product aveSq, variance, autocorr, sum;
00382       int     bufferSize = buffers_[0].size();
00383    
00384       // Calculate average of sampled values
00385       ave  = sum_;
00386       ave /= double(nSample_*nEnsemble_);
00387       aveSq = product(ave, ave);
00388       variance = corr_[0]/double(nCorr_[0]*nEnsemble_);
00389       variance = variance - aveSq;
00390    
00391       // Sum over autocorrelation function
00392       setToZero(sum);
00393       for (int i = 1; i < bufferSize/2; ++i) {
00394          autocorr = corr_[i]/double(nCorr_[i]*nEnsemble_);
00395          autocorr = autocorr - aveSq;
00396          sum += autocorr;
00397       }
00398       sum /= variance;
00399       
00400       return sum; 
00401    }

00403    /*
00404    * Serialize this AutoCorrArray.
00405    */
00406    template <typename Data, typename Product>
00407    template <class Archive>
00408    void AutoCorrArray<Data, Product>::serialize(Archive& ar, 
00409                                                 const unsigned int version)
00410    {
00411       ar & buffers_; 
00412       ar & corr_;
00413       ar & nCorr_;
00414       ar & sum_;
00415       ar & ensembleCapacity_;
00416       ar & bufferCapacity_;
00417       ar & nEnsemble_;
00418       ar & nSample_;
00419    }
